intro: Pharus ovalifolius, commonly known as the oval-leaf pharus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its elliptical-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its unique foliage and ornamental flowers, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
